meanings.definition: A soft, white fibrous substance that surrounds the seeds of a tropical and subtropical plant.
meanings.sent1: The cotton felt fluffy and gentle against her skin.
meanings.sent2: Farmers grow cotton to make clothes and sheets.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with a ball of cotton, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as light as cotton, soothing everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The cotton clouds floated lazily in the sky, like soft pillows.

meanings.definition: A plant that produces cotton fibers.
meanings.sent1: The cotton plant needs warm weather to thrive.
meanings.sent2: In the fields, you can see rows of cotton plants swaying in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome had a tiny cotton plant growing in his pot.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas blossomed like a cotton plant, spreading creativity everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The cotton plant stood tall, proud of its fluffy white blooms.

meanings.definition: A fabric made from cotton fibers.
meanings.sent1: She preferred the comfort of cotton over synthetic fabrics.
meanings.sent2: The cotton shirt was cool and breathable in the summer heat.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a never-ending string of cotton fabric from his hat.
meanings.sent4: His words were woven together like a delicate cotton fabric, creating a beautiful story.
meanings.sent5: The cotton fabric draped elegantly, flowing like a gentle stream.
